artist: Designer: George Washington Maher; Manufacturer: Gorham Manufacturing Company; Retailer: Spaulding & Company, Chicago, Illinois
creditline: Gift of funds from the Decorative Arts Council with proceeds from the 2005 Antiques Show and Sale
description: small bowl with three flame-shaped tines; gold-washed tines and bowl, silver handle; handle decorated with long-stemmed lilies with two flowers and two buds and EKG monogram
markings: on back of handle, stamped: [SPAULDING & CO. CHICAGO]; on side of handle, stamped: [(lion) (anchor) G (?) Martelé]
object_name: Ice cream fork, from a twelve-piece place setting
portfolio: From Designed for Rockledge, the E. L. King House, Homer, MN (demolished 1987)
title: Ice cream fork, from a twelve-piece place setting
